'''Sir Bonar Neville-Kingdom''' is an Internet hoax focusing around statements, Twitters and video interviews by a man purporting to be [[Permanent Secretary]] at Large and variously Technology Outreach Czar and Big Data Czar for Her Majesty's Government of the [[United Kingdom]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zdnet.com/book-review-the-twitters-of-sir-bonar-neville-kingdom-4010021158/|title=Book review: The Twitters of Sir Bonar Neville-Kingdom|author=Wendy M. Grossman|publisher=ZDNet}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.computerweekly.com/blogs/public-sector/2011/01/whitehall-power-brokers-pick-a.html|title=Whitehall power brokers pick at Open Sores|publisher=Computer Weekly|author=Mark Ballard}}</ref> In 2008, Sir Bonar was cited in a Guardian [[April 1st]] hoax article about the British government's "[[Panopticon]]" plan, the "National Operational Deterrence and Intelligence Surveillance System" (NODISS).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theregister.co.uk/2008/04/01/nodiss_revealed/|title=Blogging Whitehall mandarin had top secret 'panopticon' plan|author=Arsene Ghia|date=2008-04-01}}</ref> The first year of Twitter postings (@sirbonar) were collected into a book, ''The Twitters of Sir Bonar Neville-Kingdom''.<ref>Book reference at www.lulu.com/shop/sir-bonar-neville-kingdom/the-twitters-of-sir-bonar-neville-kingdom/ebook/product-17367616.html</ref> "Sir Bonar" regularly expresses strong support for the war on drugs, for the construction of physical protection measures around Whitehall ("Bonar's Bollards") and for all forms of total population surveillance. For example, he weighed in in favor of the [[Communications Data Bill 2012]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.computerweekly.com/opinion/Why-the-Data-Communications-Bill-is-proportionate-measured-and-necessary|title=Why the Data Communications Bill is proportionate, measured and necessary|author=Sir Bonar Neville-Kingdom|publisher=Computer Weekly}}</ref>
